subject: Business
title: Customer Discovery Interviews
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Customer Discovery Interviews.

hook.text: You think you know what customers want. Talk to five of them and everything changes.

buildup.text: Customer discovery means asking open-ended questions about problems â€” not pitching your solution.

discovery.text: The Mom Test: never ask 'Would you use this?' People lie to be nice. Ask about past behavior.

twist.text: The best insights come from complaints. 'What's the hardest part about X?' reveals real pain.

climax.text: Five good interviews often reveal more than a 500-person survey. Depth beats breadth early on.

quiz.question: What does The Mom Test advise against asking?
options: 'What's the hardest part of your workflow?'
'When did you last face this problem?'
